title.value: OpenForest: A data catalogue for machine learning in forest monitoring
title.justification: Title is clearly mentioned in the provided document.
title.quote: OpenForest: A data catalogue for machine learning in forest monitoring

extractions.description: This paper presents 'OpenForest', a dynamic, open-access catalogue encompassing 86 forest datasets for machine learning applications in forest monitoring. The catalogue includes inventories, ground-based, aerial, and satellite recordings, as well as country or worldwide maps. The goal is to provide a central hub for forest data to inspire research and enhance methodologies in forest biology and machine learning.

type.justification: The study extensively reviews and provides an actual database of open-access datasets for practical applications in machine learning, indicative of empirical work.
type.quote: Forests play a crucial role in Earthâ€™s system processes and provide a suite of social and economic ecosystem services... Here, we provide a comprehensive and extensive overview of 86 open access forest datasets across spatial scales...

name.justification: The paper focuses on using various machine learning and computer vision techniques to process data for forest monitoring.
name.quote: In recent years, the applications of remote sensing data for Earth-related purposes [40, 197], such as forest monitoring [87, 151, 75, 209], have gained momentum due to the adoption of machine learning methods and algorithms. It has been inspired by continuous improvements in the performance of deep learning models used in computer vision challenges.

name.justification: The paper directly relates to applications in forest biology and ecology, linking it to the study of natural environments.
name.quote: Moreover, in the context of these datasets, we aim to inspire research in machine learning applied to forest biology by establishing connections between contemporary topics, perspectives and challenges inherent in both domains.

name.justification: The techniques and methodologies mentioned revolve around various machine learning applications and paradigms.
name.quote: Advancing forest monitoring worldwide offers advantages...Recent strides in machine learning and computer vision have reached important milestones using remote sensing data...

name.justification: SAM is mentioned as a significant method for instance segmentation, particularly useful for forest monitoring tasks like tree crown segmentation.
name.quote: In the field of computer vision, for example, the Segment Anything Model (SAM) [158] has demonstrated the capability to perform instance segmentation by leveraging prompts in conjunction with input images.

is_contributed.justification: The SAM model is referenced, not introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: the Segment Anything Model (SAM) [158] has demonstrated the capability to perform instance segmentation

is_executed.justification: There is no indication in the text that the model was executed in this paper.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare SAM numerically with other models.
is_compared.quote: Segment Anything Model...has demonstrated the capability to perform instance segmentation

referenced_paper_title.justification: The original referenced paper for this model is not explicitly provided.

name.justification: UNet is mentioned in the context of segmentation tasks related to UAV imagery for forest monitoring.
name.quote: recently publicly released aerial datasets contain RGB images generated by photogrammetry since they are relatively simple and cheap to collect [212, 149, 156, 263, 215, 150, 98, 247]. But the original RGB point cloud carrying the height information used to generate the DSM is generally not provided with some exceptions [31, 306].

is_contributed.justification: UNet is not introduced in this paper but referenced.

is_executed.justification: There is no mention of UNet being executed in the paper's examples.

is_compared.justification: UNet is not numerically compared to other models in this paper.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The original referenced paper title for UNet was part of the sources [31, 306].
referenced_paper_title.quote: But the original RGB point cloud carrying the height information used to generate the DSM is generally not provided with some exceptions [31, 306].

name.justification: Mask R-CNN is referenced as an existing model used for instance segmentation, which relates to the task of delineating individual tree crowns.
name.quote: They commonly contain tree height, crown diameter, diameter at breast height (DBH) or diameter at soil height (DSH) [214, 103, 227, 226, 216, 145].

is_contributed.justification: Mask R-CNN is cited but not contributed by the paper.

is_executed.justification: There is no mention that Mask R-CNN was executed in the scope of the study.

is_compared.justification: The model is not compared with other models numerically in the paper.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Reference title is part of sources.
referenced_paper_title.quote: diameter at breast height (DBH) or diameter at soil height (DSH) [214, 103, 227, 226, 216, 145]

name.justification: YOLO is discussed in relation to object detection tasks, including its application to detecting tree canopies and segments.
name.quote: Aerial datasets consist of recordings of sensors mounted on unoccupied (drones) or occupied aircrafts flying above the tree canopy, offering a broader perspective of the forest without the hindrance of obstacles impeding the automatic recording process.

is_contributed.justification: Although the model is not a contribution of this paper, it is cited as a relevant method

is_executed.justification: There is no explicit mention of YOLO being executed in this paper's context.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not provide numeric comparisons involving YOLO.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Reference title is part of sources.
referenced_paper_title.quote: offering a broader perspective of the forest without the hindrance of obstacles impeding the automatic recording process [225].

name.value: Commonwealth Science Industrial Research Organisation (CSIRO) Forest Monitoring
name.justification: The CSIRO dataset integrates a range of measurements from various forest ecosystems in Australia, enhancing global forest monitoring capabilities through its contribution to the OpenForest catalog.
name.quote: Moreover, we conduct a thorough review of open access forest datasets across different spatial scales (Fig. 2) to support both machine learning and biology research communities in their work (Sec. 4).

referenced_paper_title.justification: Reference title is part of sources.
referenced_paper_title.quote: support both machine learning and biology research communities in their work (Sec. 4).

name.justification: Google Earth Engine is referenced for data processing, visualization, and analysis of large-scale geospatial datasets, including those within the OpenForest catalogue.
name.quote: Participatory mapping of forest plantations with Open Foris and Google Earth Engine. ISPRS Journal of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The citation indicates direct usage or reference of the library for forest data processing.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Participatory mapping of forest plantations with Open Foris and Google Earth Engine. ISPRS Journal of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing.
